name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

name: $addidentifier
desc: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

name: $basedOn
desc: Returns: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

name: $addbasedOn
desc: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The status of the result value.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The status of the result value.

name: $category
desc: Returns: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

name: $addcategory
desc: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

name: $code
desc: Returns: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

name: $subject
desc: Returns: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed.  Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, donor,  other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed.  Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, dono

name: $context
desc: Returns: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

name: $issued
desc: Returns: The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

name: $performer
desc: Returns: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

name: $addperformer
desc: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

name: $dataAbsentReason
desc: Returns: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

name: $interpretation
desc: Returns: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag.

name: $comment
desc: Returns: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.

name: $bodySite
desc: Returns: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

name: $method
desc: Returns: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

name: $specimen
desc: Returns: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

name: $device
desc: Returns: The device used to generate the observation data.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The device used to generate the observation data.

name: $referenceRange
desc: Returns: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

name: $addreferenceRange
desc: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

name: $related
desc: Returns: A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code.

name: $addrelated
desc: A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code.

name: $component
desc: Returns: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

name: $addcomponent
desc: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement
